intro: Podaletra, commonly known as the blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Podaletra has narrow, linear leaves and produces seeds in small, three-lobed capsules. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
